articles.title: Kim Jong Un Inspects Construction Projects Undertaken by KPA
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Inspects Construction Projects Undertaken by KPA
Pyongyang, January 11 (KCNA) -- Supreme Commander of the Korean People's Army Kim Jong Un, supreme leader of the Workers' Party of Korea, state and army, inspected various construction projects undertaken by KPA service personnel including the Pyongyang Folk Park and the Meat Shop in Hero Street. 
					He was greeted on the spot by commanding officers of the units engaged in the construction.
					
					Going round various projects for hours, he acquainted himself in detail with the progress made in the construction, etc.
					
					He asked in detail commanding officers at each project about how big amount of work is to be done, what measures are taken to supply building materials and what is knotty problems in the construction.
					
					Making the round of the construction site of the Pyongyang Folk Park taking its shape day by day, in particular, he learned about what measures are taken to preserve well the excellent culture and tradition of the Korean nation and how buildings of reduced size such as the Party Founding Memorial Tower, the West Sea Barrage, the Grand People's Study House and the Mansudae Art Theatre are being built to their original state.
					
					He was satisfied to learn that commanding officers and soldier-builders have contrived and introduced innovative construction methods for pushing forward the project without letup even under the recent unfavorable weather conditions by pooling creative wisdom and are ensuring both quality and speed by carrying out work in a bold and big manner.
					
					He praised the officials of the project command for opening a bright vista for finishing the construction as scheduled and expanding the achievements by minutely working out a plan for each process and properly organizing construction and command in keeping with a high degree of enthusiasm of the soldier-builders.
					
					Going round construction projects, he gave precious instructions to be implemented for constructing buildings in a peculiar manner as monumental edifices in the era of the Workers' Party and the Songun era.
					
					He underscored the need to construct the buildings in a responsible manner and properly level areas to match the landscape of their vicinity as the projects undertaken by the People's Army are important ones for realizing the lifetime wishes of leader            Kim Jong Il who made so much effort to provide the people with more affluent living conditions and highly civilized living environments. 
					
					He called for constructing even a single building in such a way as to be impeccable in the distant future, regarding the WPK's Juche-based idea and theory of architectural beauty as a firm guiding principle.
					
					The Pyongyang Folk Park should be built in such a way as to be in line with the principle of historicism and meet the modern aesthetic need and to enable the people and the school youth and children to have good rest and acquire ample knowledge, he noted.
					
					He also underlined the need to thoroughly implement the Party's policy of putting architecture on a formative artistic basis and thus complete all the projects at the best level so that they may look like spectacular not only when viewed from distance but at close range.
					
					He underscored the need to introduce reasonable and scientific construction methods to push ahead with the project without interruption and successfully build facilities to view buildings as the construction of the park is a hard project requiring a lot of effort and is beset with technological and engineering bottlenecks. He took a benevolent measure for this.
					
					He emphasized the need to build the Meat Shop in Hero Street in such a way as to provide the best conveniences to the customers as the shop will be frequented by them, adding that to this end it is necessary to thoroughly embody the serve-the-people spirit and kindness in the construction.
					
					He called on the relevant units to minutely ensure a timely and sufficient supply of building materials, transport means, etc.  necessary for construction in keeping with the rapid progress of the project. 
					
					He expressed great expectation and conviction that the soldier-builders would fully display the stamina of the general offensive in the revolutionary soldier spirit and in the spirit of conducting an offensive under the motto "At one go" and thus complete their construction projects as scheduled.

articles.title: DPRK Will Follow U.S. Moves: FM Spokesman
articles.content:
DPRK Will Follow U.S. Moves: FM Spokesman
Pyongyang, January 11 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Foreign Ministry of the DPRK gave the following answer to a question put by KCNA on Wednesday as regard the U.S. offer of food aid:
					Recently some forces have spread sinister rumor over the issue of the U.S. food aid to the DPRK by distorting the present situation of their own accord. 
					
					What cannot be overlooked is the fact that the hostile forces have talked nonsense that the DPRK asked for food aid due to the hardships by the great loss to the nation. 
					
					The issue of food aid now on the agenda between the DPRK and the U.S. came up early in 2011 when the U.S. raised the provision of 330 000 tons of food it failed to do. The U.S. promised to offer 500 000 tons three years ago. 
					
					At the beginning the U.S. asserted that food aid had nothing to do with politics as it is a humanitarian issue. 
					
					The U.S., at the DPRK-U.S. high-ranking talks started in July 2011, proposed to take confidence-building steps such as suspension of sanctions as well as food aid in case the DPRK takes similar steps such as temporary suspension of uranium enrichment the former asked. After all the U.S. itself raised this problem as political. 
					
					But, the U.S. has drastically changed the amount and items of provision contrary to the originally promised food aid of more than 300 000 tons. So, the DPRK cannot but have doubt about the U.S. will for confidence building, and this compels the former to return to the boundary discussed in May 2011. 
					
					We will watch if the U.S. truly wants to build confidence.

articles.title: Guinean President on Steady Development of Friendly and Cooperative Relations with DPRK
articles.content:
Guinean President on Steady Development of Friendly and Cooperative Relations with DPRK
Pyongyang, January 11 (KCNA) -- Alpha Conde, president of Guinea, once again expressed sincere condolences to the Korean people on the untimely demise of leader Kim Jong Il, when receiving Kim Su Il, charge d'affaires a.i. of the DPRK in Conakry on Jan. 4.
					I hope the Korean people will overcome their sorrow with strength and courage and achieve greater success in carrying out the economic tasks and the cause of national reunification set forth in the joint New Year editorial, holding HE Kim Jong Un in high esteem, he noted, and continued:
					
					I hope the long-standing friendly and cooperative relations between the DPRK and Guinea would steadily grow stronger.

articles.title: Condolences to Kim Jong Un from Grenadian PM
articles.content:
Condolences to Kim Jong Un from Grenadian PM
Pyongyang, January 11 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un received a message of condolences from Grenadian Prime Minister Tillman Thomas on Dec. 19 last year.
					The message said:
					
					The passing away of Chairman Kim Jong Il is a great sorrow to the Grenadian government and people.
					
					I, on behalf of the Grenadian government and people, express our deepest condolences to you and the DPRK government and people on the demise of Chairman Kim Jong Il.
					
					His demise gave a bitter grief to the Korean people.
					
					The Grenadian government and people assure you that they will express heartfelt condolences to the Korean people in this mourning period.

articles.title: Opera Performance Squad of DPRK Comes Back from China
articles.content:
Opera Performance Squad of DPRK Comes Back from China
Pyongyang, January 11 (KCNA) -- The DPRK performance squad of opera "Liang Shanbo and Zhu Yingtai" came back home on Wednesday after winding up its visit to China.
					Present at Pyongyang Railway Station to greet and congratulate its leading members and artistes on their successful performance were Secretary of the C.C., Workers' Party of Korea Kim Ki Nam, Minister of Culture An Tong Chun, officials concerned, creators and artistes in the field of culture and art, and Ambassador Liu Hongcai and staff members of the Chinese embassy here.

articles.title: New Year's Concert Inspires All People in Grand March
articles.content:
New Year's Concert Inspires All People in Grand March
Pyongyang, January 11 (KCNA) -- The New Year's concert "The Cause of the Sun Will Be Immortal" was given by the Unhasu Orchestra at the East Pyongyang Grand Theatre from Jan. 5 to 11.
					An estimated 12 000 people appreciated the concert.
					
					After enjoying the concert Jong Kwang Hyok, a teacher of Kim Il Sung University, told KCNA, "When a picture of leader Kim Jong Il going round the swimming complex of our university appeared in the stage background, I got so excited. I am missing him very much."
					
					Kim Chun Rim, an actress of the National Theatrical Troupe, said, "As the song 'Thought of Love' tells, leader Kim Jong Il's love for the people reached all parts and all people of the country. The Korean artistes could lead the happiest life in the world thanks to Kim Jong Il, a peerlessly great man."
					
					Jon Un Gyong, an employee of the Hana Electronic Joint Venture Company, said: 
					
					"Listening to female solo and chorus 'Oh, We Miss You, Leader' and chorus 'Song of Love for People', I thought of leader Kim Jong Il, who gave field guidance to our working site in one of his last days. I will work hard, always remembering his tireless efforts for providing the people with bountiful and highly civilized life."
					
					Sin Myong Il, an officer of the Korean People's Army (KPA), said that the concert made him renew his determination to devote himself to defending socialist Korea glorified by leader Kim Jong Il, true to the Songun revolutionary leadership of Kim Jong Un, supreme commander of the KPA.
					
					Ri Ja Yong, an official of the State Planning Commission, said:
					
					"Female trio and chorus 'Under Guidance of Kim Il Sung', chorus 'Might of Korea' and narrative and orchestral music 'Korea Has Risen Up' greatly inspire all people to turn out in the new year's grand march. The performance is the declaration of the start of this year's advance.
					
					I will strive hard to bring about another upsurge in socialist construction this year under the leadership of Kim Jong Un, supreme leader of the Workers' Party of Korea, state and army, to glorify the new century of Kim Il Sung's nation as one of prosperity and great victories."

articles.title: Performance by KPA Song And Dance Ensemble Goes On
articles.content:
Music and Dance Performance Goes On
Pyongyang, January 11 (KCNA) -- A music and dance performance "Let Us Uphold Our Supreme Commander Forever" is going on at the April 25 House of Culture. 
					Men and officers of the Korean People's Army and working people in the city of Pyongyang enjoyed the performance on Wednesday.
					
					All the performers and audiences paid a silent tribute in humble reverence to the memory of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					The performance began with immortal revolutionary hymn "Song of General Kim Jong Il".
					
					Wind-instrumental music and mixed choruses "Comrade Kim Jong Il Is Our Supreme Commander" and "The Victorious Parade", female solo "Snow Falls on Road to Front", female solo and mixed pangchang (off-stage song) "Where Are You, Dear General?", an immortal masterpiece, and male chorus "The Sound of a Horse's Hooves in Mt. Paektu" made the audiences permeated with deep yearning for Kim Jong Il.
					
					Then such choruses resounded as "We Will Become Air-defence Shield", "Leader, Just Give Us Your Order" and "Might of Korea" to display the iron will of the invincible revolutionary army of Mt. Paektu to devotedly defend the headquarters of the revolution with arms, true to its oath taken before the bier of Kim Jong Il in bloody tears.
					
					The numbers of the performance also included wind-instrumental music and mixed chorus "Footstep", "We Will Safeguard General Kim Jong Un with Our Lives" and "Long Live the Great Illustrious Commander of Songun" that reflect the firm faith and pledge of the service personnel of the KPA to surely carry to completion the revolutionary cause of Juche, the revolutionary cause of Songun, with arms, holding the dear respected Kim Jong Un in high esteem as the supreme commander.

articles.title: Centenary of Birth of People's Artiste Hwang Chol Observed in DPRK
articles.content:
Centenary of Birth of People's Artiste Hwang Chol Observed in DPRK
Pyongyang, January 11 (KCNA) -- The centenary of birth of People's Artiste Hwang Chol was commemorated in the DPRK.
					Hwang took part in the historic April Joint Conference of Representatives of Political Parties and Public Organizations in North and South Korea just after the liberation of the country, at the call of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					The President gave in to Hwang's ardent wish to create dramatic arts in the northern half of Korea.
					
					Hwang directed and played leading part in such artistic works as dramas "Admiral Ri Sun Sin" and "The Family of Choe Hak Sin" and feature film "The Tale of Chun Hyang".
					
					He trained many talented actors and actresses and authored papers including "Stage Narration" and "Theory of Makeup" and a large number of critiques, notes and essays.
					
					He won high appreciation in international arena for his successful puppetry scenario.
					
					He worked as a deputy to the Supreme People's Assembly, president of the National Theatre, vice-minister of Education and Culture, etc.
					
					A meeting of remembering him took place at the National Theatre on Wednesday.
					
					Ri Ji Yong, chairman of the C.C., the Dramatic Artistes Union of Korea, addressing the meeting said that Hwang Chol is still alive as the first People's Artiste in the DPRK and winner of the National Reunification Prize under the loving care of the peerlessly great men who added shine to the life of the revolutionary soldier and showed deep benevolence for him.
					
					Attending the meeting were Minister of Culture An Tong Chun, officials, creators and artistes in the field of culture and art, teachers and students in the field of art education and Hwang's bereaved family and related persons.

articles.title: National Reconciliation, Unity Decisive of Country's Reunification
articles.content:
National Reconciliation, Unity Decisive of Country's Reunification
Pyongyang, January 11 (KCNA) -- The joint New Year editorial says that national reconciliation and unity are a precondition and guarantee for national reunification.
					It is imperative for the improvement of relations between the north and the south of Korea to achieve national reconciliation and unity.
					
					Different ideologies and social systems have existed in the north and the south of Korea, aggravating distrust and confrontation between the fellow countrymen, due to its division caused by foreign interference,.
					
					Last year the DPRK called for improving relations between the two halves of Korea through dialogue and cooperation and opening the gate to peace and reunification.
					
					But the south Korean authorities, giving lip-service to dialogue, have persistently sought confrontation and war to escalate tension on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					They answered the DPRK's sincere proposal and efforts for dialogue with the absurd demand for a solution to the warship Cheonan and Yonphyong Island incidents and sincere measure for a solution to the nuclear issue.
					
					They even hurt the supreme dignity of the DPRK and staged military exercises against the DPRK like "Key Resolve" and "Foal Eagle" in collusion with foreign forces. 
					
					National reconciliation and unity will never be achieved with one side seeking confrontation with the other side, adhering to its ideology and social system, indifferent to the interests of the nation.
					
					The interests common to the nation should be put above anything else.
					
					The DPRK remains unchanged in its principled stand to improve the inter-Korean relations through dialogue and solve the issue of reunification in a peaceful way by achieving national reconciliation and unity.

articles.title: Rural Communities Busy with Preparations for New Year's Farming
articles.content:
Rural Communities Busy with Preparations for New Year's Farming
Pyongyang, January 11 (KCNA) -- Preparations for farming are in full swing in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					Trucks and tractors are busy carrying manure to fields throughout the country.
					
					Farmers have turned out in the effort for implementing the behests of leader Kim Jong Il for solving the food problem. 
					
					The Migok Cooperative Farm in Sariwon City, North Hwanghae Province, Tongbong Cooperative Farm in Hamju County, South Hamgyong Province, Samjigang Co-op Farm in Jaeryong County, South Hwanghae Province and other farms have transported several hundred tons of manure to fields  every day from the first day of the year.
					
					The cooperative farms in Thaechon County, North Phyongan Province, are working on producing phosphorite, calcined clay and organic fertilizers.
					
					Hoeyang County in Kangwon Province and Yonggwang County in South Hamgyong Province have carpeted scores of hectares of fields with humus soil over the past five days.
					
					Meanwhile, assistance to rural communities has been intensified.
					
					Officials of Pyongyang-based ministries and national institutions carried large quantities of quality manure to cooperative farms on January 6.
					
					Officials and workers of industrial establishments in South Hamgyong, South Phyongan and Jagang provinces have sent various kinds of farming tools and materials to farms.

articles.title: Phenomena Witnessed in Mourning Days (3) Bird Stiffened to Death on Fir Tree Branch
articles.content:
Phenomena Witnessed in Mourning Days (3) Bird Stiffened to Death on Fir Tree Branch
Pyongyang, January 11 (KCNA) -- After the sad news about the demise of leader Kim Jong Il was released in Korea on December 19, many people visited the Naedong Revolutionary Site in the town of Jasong County, Jagang Province to express deep condolences over his passing away.
					Next morning the grief-stricken people happened to see a bird sitting on a branch of a fir tree.
					
					Though they approached the tree, the bird did not fly. Then they knew that the bird was stiffened to death with its legs sticking on the branch.
					
					The fir tree stands a few meters from the spot where the leader posed for a photo with lecturers, when he visited the site some years ago.

articles.title: University Students Conduct Socio-Political Activities at Power Complex
articles.content:
University Students Conduct Socio-Political Activities at Power Complex
Pyongyang, January 11 (KCNA) -- University students here conducted socio-political activities during their winter vacation. 
					Officials of youth league organizations and students of universities including Kim Il Sung University and Kim Hyong Jik University of Education went to the Pyongyang Thermal Power Complex alive with a drive for increased power production from the outset of the year. They conducted diverse political activities such as explaining the contents of the joint New Year editorial to workers and publishing prompt reports about successes, encouraging them in their drive for great surge. 
					
					They gave sincere helping hands to the workers while conducting frontline-style agitation.

articles.title: KCNA Urges Japan not to Evade Responsibility for Sexual Slavery
articles.content:
KCNA Urges Japan Not to Evade Responsibility for Sexual Slavery
Pyongyang, January 11 (KCNA) -- Going global is a movement urging Japan to make an official apology and reparation for the sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army.
					Solidarity activities were staged in succession in more than 40 cities of 9 countries and regions including the United States, Germany, Canada and Italy.
					
					At least 1 000 Wednesday rallies have been staged outside the Japanese embassy in Seoul since Jan. 8, 1992 under the auspices of the south Korean Council for the Solution of the Issue of the Volunteers' Corps. Not long ago, a peace monument was erected in reflection of the unanimous demand of south Koreans of different social standings. 
					
					The monument reflects the grudge of the Korean women who were taken to be sexual slaves for the Imperial Japanese Army. 
					
					Japan, however, is shameless enough to call for the removal of the monument in disregard of the atmosphere of the international community critical of the sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army.
					
					Japan had committed the most heinous crimes against ethics in history during its 40 odd-year-long colonial rule over Korea.
					
					It forced 200 000 Korean women into sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army. This was the most despicable and cruel crime in terms of barbarous and organized nature and scale. 
					
					What should not be overlooked is that the Japanese reactionaries have become evermore undisguised in their attempts to deny the above-said crime in recent years when the international community is becoming more vocal demanding Japan's settlement of its past.
					
					They went the lengths of blustering that "Japan does not feel guilty of any wrongdoing during World War Ⅱ". Moreover, they called for amending the statement made by Chief Cabinet Secretary Kono in 1993 in which he admitted Japan's responsibility for "comfort women". 
					
					This is the present reality of Japan. 
					
					Japan is the most impudent and brazen-faced country in the world.
					
					Japan is shrewd and self-interested. But there is one thing Japan cannot go without settling. 
					
					Japan has evaded its responsibility for its past crimes up to this date. For this it has not shaken off the disgrace of being a political pigmy.
					
					More than 60 years have passed since the end of World War Ⅱ, but  the international community still regards Japan as an untrustworthy state as it has not yet settled its past. 
					
					This amounts to the biggest political loss to Japan, several hundred dearer than the economic price it has to pay for its past wrongs. 
					
					Japan's denial of its crimes against ethics in the last century which make even animals blush is only adding to its past crimes. 
					
					Japan would be well advised to come down to earth and opt for settling its crime-woven past.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Implementing Tasks Laid Down in Joint Calls
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Implementing Tasks Laid Down in Joint Calls
Pyongyang, January 11 (KCNA) -- The entire party and army and all people should successfully implement the militant tasks set forth in the joint calls of the Central Committee and Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea made public on the occasion of the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung and thus fully demonstrate the spirit of winning sure victory of Songun Korea.
					Rodong Sinmun Wednesday says this in a bylined article.
					
					It is the main spirit of the joint calls that the entire party and army and all people should turn sorrow into redoubled strength and courage under the wise leadership of the dear respected Kim Jong Un and thus glorify 2012 as a year of great victory when the steadfast succession and invincibility of the Korean revolution are demonstrated to the world, a year of prosperity when the gate of a thriving nation is flung open, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					The joint calls serve as a banner of great unity to be carried forward generation after generation and a banner of Songun revolution which makes it possible to give steady continuity to the traditions of arms of Mt. Paektu.
					
					They, at the same time, serve as a banner of leap forward and innovations as they help bring about a great surge in improving the standard of people's living and building a thriving nation and a banner of ardent patriotism which calls on the whole country to turn out in a nationwide gigantic advance.
					
					The flames kindled by leader Kim Jong Il in South Hamgyong Province last year, the flames of industrial revolution in the new century, serve as a banner of the onward general offensive and an engine for effecting great leap forward and innovations.
					
					Officials should become forefront commanding officers in the advance for great surge, party members vanguard fighters in the onward movement for final victory in 2012, the youths a main player in building a thriving nation who bravely advances keeping pace with the footsteps of the illustrious commander of Songun and all citizens should perform feats and thus demonstrate the honor of victors in the on-going general offensive.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun on Revolutionary Faith
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun on Revolutionary Faith
Pyongyang, January 11 (KCNA) -- Revolutionary faith provides ideological and moral source for displaying iron mettle, indomitable will, matchless bravery and self-sacrificing spirit to overcome trials and serves as a powerful weapon for winning victory in revolution.
					Rodong Sinmun Wednesday says this in a bylined article.
					
					It goes on:
					
					Whoever has strong faith is sure to triumph. This is truth proven by the practical experience gained in the Korean revolution.
					
					The army and people of the DPRK have waged a do-or-die struggle against the U.S. imperialists with the strong courage and mettle that the cause of independence and justice is always sure to triumph despite any storm and stress.
					
					Unshakable is their faith that they will fight against the U.S. imperialists till they win a victory.
					
					One should have confidence that the cause of independence is sure to win. Independence represents justice and it is sure to triumph.
					
					Some people of certain countries lack firm faith in victory in the cause of independence at a time when the imperialists and reactionaries run amuck. There are even people vacillating. But the dawn of history is sure to break and a new morning is sure to dawn for progressive mankind.
					
					The imperialists and reactionaries are running amuck, counting on their military and economic superiorities.
					
					The imperialists, however, are now going downhill.
					
					One should not hesitate before temporary difficulties. The cause of independence is by no means a smooth sailing. One may suffer bitter pain and sorrow and stern trials and has to cross steep mountain ranges in one's way. 
					
					One is sure to emerge a winner, if one weathers difficulties with firm faith that victory is in store despite unbearable adversity.
					
					Victory is in store for those independent people with strong faith.

articles.title: Japan's "Three Principles of Arms Export" No More Than Scrap of Paper: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Japan's "Three Principles of Arms Export" No More Than Scrap of Paper: Rodong Sinmun
Pyongyang, January 11 (KCNA) -- The Japanese government amended the "Three Principles of Arms Export" late in December last year and decided to jointly develop defense equipment with other countries and transfer them overseas. Much upset by strong rebuff of opposition parties, the present government of the Democratic Party of Japan blustered it eased the above-said principles and it will not change the principle and idea of peace.
					Rodong Sinmun Wednesday says in a bylined commentary in this regard:
					
					The radical revision made by the government of the three principles amounts to a total drop of the principles and this is, in essence, a manifestation of its intention to step up its moves to turn Japan into a military giant and launch overseas expansion in real earnest.
					
					The Japanese ruling quarters covered the arms export with the veils of peace and humanitarianism. This is aiming at hiding the criminal nature and danger of their wild ambition.
					
					Japan, hell-bent on the moves for converting itself into a military giant, is focusing its efforts on bolstering the striking power and mobile capability of the "Self-Defense Forces". Precisely for this reason its present "Defense Programme Guidelines" put main emphasis on shipbuilding and the replacement of prototype fighters and it is contemplating jointly developing arms and equipment with the U.S. Through its joint arms development with the U.S. Japan seeks to acquire latest technology of manufacturing weaponry and hold military supremacy in Asia.
					
					Japan's ultimate goal is to realize its wild ambition for reinvading Asia. Everything is subordinated to attaining the goal. Explicitly speaking, Japan has become a main danger to East Asia.
					
					It is quite natural for its neighboring countries to watch Japan with vigilance.

articles.title: Lee Myung Bak's Rigmaroles Ridiculed
articles.content:
Lee Myung Bak's Rigmaroles Ridiculed
Pyongyang, January 11 (KCNA) -- Traitor Lee Myung Bak, when receiving a report from the Ministry of Unification on Dec. 5, talked nonsense that "south Korea's consistent north policy gained a lot of achievements" and "it is beneficial to both sides". 
					Minju Joson Wednesday observes in a by-lined commentary in this regard:
					
					What Lee uttered is nothing but the revelation of his sinister intention to mislead the public opinion at home and abroad calling for making a switchover in his "north policy" and desperately pursue the policy of confrontation with fellow countrymen in the days ahead, too.
					
					This was clearly evidenced by his blustering that "south Korea needs a consistent policy as it requires a change in the north" and "it is hard to predict what changes will take place in the north". 
					
					It is not the north but the south where changes will occur.
					
					The destruction of the Lee group is inevitable as it has no one to trust and depend on. 
					
					Nevertheless, Lee vociferated about "changes in the north", rattling the nerves of the army and people of the DPRK. This has only added to his crimes.
					
					The Lee group lost its last opportunity for dealing with the DPRK as it committed crimes against ethics during the nation's mourning over the great loss. He is now working hard to mislead the public opinion and cover up his crimes, but his sleight of hand will not work on anyone. 
					
					The DPRK is making every possible effort to achieve independent reunification and peace and prosperity by implementing to the letter the three charters for national reunification and the north-south declarations. The traitor, however, groundlessly depicted this stark reality recognized by everybody as a manifestation of its intention to "achieve unification by communizing the south." This is absolutely intolerable as it is another political provocation to the DPRK. 
					
					His moves to escalate the confrontation with compatriots will get him nowhere. They will only precipitate his self-destruction. Time will prove it.

articles.title: S. Koreans Brand Ruling GNP as Corrupt Party
articles.content:
S. Koreans Brand Ruling GNP as Corrupt Party
Pyongyang, January 11 (KCNA) -- The floor leader of the opposition Democratic United Party (DUP) of south Korea in a press conference on Sunday criticized the ruling "Grand National Party" as a corrupt party. 
					Referring to the recent illegalities by Lee Myung Bak's aides, Ddos attacks on the website of the Central Election Committee, a bribery scandal, etc., he ridiculed that the GNP did not abandon its true nature as a scandal-ridden party. 
					
					He urged the GNP to apologize to the people for such wrongdoings. 
					
					On the same day Ri Sok Hyon, a lawmaker from the DUP, stated there is suspicion that the GNP engaged in fraudulent practices during the Oct. 26 Seoul mayoral election. 
					
					It is dubious that Ra Kyong Won, mayoral candidate of the GNP who lost to an independent rival, won a landslide at all electorates in the absent voting, he added.
					
					This was a result of the ruling party's organized and multi-faceted intervention, he held, underscoring the need to clear this suspicion.

articles.title: S. Korean Prosecution Accused of Its Despicable Action
articles.content:
S. Korean Prosecution Accused of Its Despicable Action
Pyongyang, January 11 (KCNA) -- The Solidarity for Progress of south Korea in a statement on Sunday accused the puppet prosecution of its despicable action to cover up the truth behind the cyber terrorism by the "Grand National Party" to serve the power.
					The statement said:
					
					The prosecution made public groundless results of the investigation, claiming that the Ddos attack on the homepage of the Central Election Commission was made by secretaries of the speaker of the "National Assembly" and Choe Ku Sik to render distinguished services.
					
					This proves that the prosecution gave up the investigation aimed at clarifying who was behind the case and launched an operation to cut off the clue to it.
					
					Querying how the secretaries of lawmakers could commit such cyber attack on the above-said commission, the statement noted: This is absolutely impossible without the instruction of a powerful boss and this is clearly proved by the words of the secretary of Choe Ku Sik that "it appears as if it had been done by me, though it was not my deed."
					
					The statement referred to the disclosure of the fact by media that the chief secretary for political affairs of Chongwadae pressurized the chief of the police agency over the phone some time ago and frequently informed Choe of how investigation was going on.
					
					The statement went on: A day before the Ddos attack Choe at a dinner with other lawmakers bragged "he had a crucial card" and when the crime was brought to light, he insisted "he would not be the only victim."
					
					The statement underscored the need to probe the truth about the case by the concerted efforts of the people, not through the police and prosecution that have not an iota of intention to probe its truth.

articles.title: Opposition to Ruling Quarters Grows Up in S. Korea
articles.content:
Opposition to Ruling Quarters Grows Up in S. Korea
Pyongyang, January 11 (KCNA) -- Public criticism of the ruling quarters is growing stronger in south Korea.
					According to an opinion poll conducted among 7 800 people throughout south Korea from Dec. 3 to 4, most of the respondents expressed opposition to the "Grand National Party's" stay in power while urging the present "government" to drop its "policy toward the north".
					
					The ruling GNP has come under accusations by the public at home and abroad for such cases as Ddos attacks on the website of the Central Election Committee aimed to win the Seoul mayoralty and a bribery scandal committed to gain the party chairmanship which were recently disclosed in the wake of the big illegalities and corruptions by Lee Myung Bak and his family members and aides.
					
					Almost those people of different walks of life involved in the recent poll demanded the replacement of the "government", saying that they would vote for a unified candidate from the opposition camp at the parliamentary election to be held in April. This is a serious warning to the ruling forces that have only engaged themselves in irregularities and corruptions, destruction of people's livelihood and confrontation policy.

articles.title: Aggressor Forces of U.S. and S. Korea on Massive Increase
articles.content:
Aggressor Forces of U.S. and S. Korea on Massive Increase
Pyongyang, January 11 (KCNA) -- The U.S. imperialists and south Korean puppet forces are massively reinforcing their aggressor forces. 
					The 19th support command of the U.S. Army introduced more than 60 new-type tanks "M1-A2 Abrams" into south Korea via Pusan Port on Jan. 9.
					
					The tanks which improved major capacity of the existing "Abrams" were transported to the Waegwan U.S. military base in Chilgok County, North Kyongsang Province.
					
					Opening to media the unloading of the new-type tanks on the pier at Pusan Port, the U.S. forces side blustered that the tanks would help bolster the operational capability of the U.S. forces as hardware to be hurled into actions in "contingency".
					
					Meanwhile, the puppet warmongers deployed ground-to-air guided missiles and portable missiles in an area near Seoul and forefront units till the end of last year before getting frantic in war maneuvers under the pretext of surprise attack from someone.
					
					They also claimed that laser devices capable of guiding fighters' ultra-precision bombing would be introduced by 2014 and deployed on islets in the West Sea of Korea before any other places.
					
					The above-said frantic arms build-up clearly proves that the dark clouds of war are hanging more heavily over the Korean Peninsula.

articles.title: GNP Tight-cornered Due to Bribery
articles.content:
GNP Tight-cornered Due to Bribery
Pyongyang, January 11 (KCNA) -- The recent disclosure of another case of bribery in south Korea has thrown the "Grand National Party" into a tighter corner. 
					Shortly ago Ko Sung Dok, a lawmaker from the GNP, said he received an envelope containing 3 million won from a pro-Lee Myung Bak candidate for chairmanship, prior to its congress during the 18th-term "National Assembly" before returning it, adding that the candidate was elected its chairman.
					
					At a time when questions were raised one after another about who distributed enveloped money, Ko disclosed on Jan. 9 he received the money from Pak Hui Thae, the present speaker of the "National Assembly".
					
					He said that the bag which the distributor of the enveloped money to him was holding was full of the same yellow envelopes, adding that money would also be distributed among other lawmakers.
					
					It was truth revealed by public in south Korea that during the party congress in 2008 Pak was far behind other candidates in opinion poll but was elected chairman of the party after the situation developed in favor of him in voting. 
					
					Thrown into discomfiture, the GNP group is making much fuss urging Pak to resign.
					
					With no desperate effort to hush the case and tide over the crisis can the GNP clan hide the true colors as a party of traitors.

articles.title: How Does DPRK Have Such Strong Unity?: Chinese Newspaper
articles.content:
How Does DPRK Have Such Strong Unity?: Chinese Newspaper
Pyongyang, January 11 (KCNA) -- Chinese Huan Qiu Shibao on Jan. 5 carried an article titled "How Does DPRK Have Such Strong Unity?" The article said:
					The memorial service for supreme leader of the DPRK Kim Jong Il held in the DPRK this time offered one an opportunity to know well that he is the most influential man of the socialist country along with President Kim Il Sung.
					
					The memorial service was closely linked with the fascinating personality of the leader. 
					
					How does the DPRK have such strong unity? 
					
					Firstly, the DPRK is a socialist state.
					
					The Korean and the world people revere the leader who loves his country like his own house and like his own family. This is the first reason why the DPRK has such strong unity.
					
					Secondly, Kim Jong Il devoted all his energies to building a thriving socialist state in the DPRK and serving the people all his life.
					
					They deeply trust socialism and Kim Jong Il as a nation with its own belief. This is the second reason for the strong unity of the DPRK.
					
					Thirdly, there is no gap between the poor and the rich in the DPRK.
					
					The people are better than those of other countries in employment, medical treatment, education, housing conditions and other aspects.
					
					The DPRK has the strongest centripetal force as its people are equal.
					
					They have one and the same feelings as the standard of their living is even. This is the third reason for the strong unity of the DPRK.

articles.title: Russian and Nepali Papers Praise Exploits of Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Russian and Nepali Papers Praise Exploits of Kim Jong Il
Pyongyang, January 11 (KCNA) -- Russian and Nepali papers carried special write-ups on the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					No. 1 and 2 of the Russian newspaper Patriot devoted their several pages to articles titled "Permanent and Great Heritage" and "The Cause of People Is Immortal," etc.
					
					The paper said that in the demise of distinguished leader Kim Jong Il progressive humankind lost the centre of struggle against the evil of the world, adding that even the enemies who dislike the DPRK admired his outstanding political caliber.
					
					It continued:
					
					There is a limit to a human life but great ideas and exploits are immortal. Progressive mankind will always remember Kim Jong Il for his special contribution to the cause of socialism and the popular masses' cause of independence. His exploits will remain an ever-lasting heritage.
					
					The Nepali paper Majodur on Jan. 3 carried an article titled "Last Farewell to Leader Kim Jong Il".
					
					The paper noted that personages and people of various circles in many countries of the world who admire socialism in the DPRK and know well about it sent messages of condolences to the dear respected Kim Jong Un, visited DPRK missions in each country to express condolences and highly praised the exploits of Kim Jong Il.
					
					Meanwhile, the Jordanian newspaper Al Diyar in its issue on Dec. 31 last year carried an article "Kim Jong Il Served the People" written by Marwan Sudah, chairman of the Arab Committee for Solidarity with Korean People and Supporting the Reunification of Korea.
					
					The paper in the article recalled Kim Jong Il visited every nook and corner of the country including Huichon without rest and wisely led the work for developing the economy of the country to meet the need of the age of knowledge-based economy, adding that he was a great man, indeed.

articles.title: Mexican Political Parties and Organizations Praise Kim Jong Un as Great Man
articles.content:
Mexican Political Parties and Organizations Praise Kim Jong Un as Great Man
Pyongyang, January 11 (KCNA) -- Political parties and organizations of Mexico released a joint statement on Jan. 2 in support of the joint New Year editorial of Rodong Sinmun, Joson Inmingun and Chongnyon Jonwi, leading newspapers of the DPRK. Among them were the People's Socialist Party, the Socialist Popular Party, the Socialist Party, the National Coordinating Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea, the Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism, the Institute for the Study of the Juche Idea, the Fellowship Institute to Honor the Memory of President Kim Il Sung, the Committee for Supporting Korea's Reunification and the Mexico-Korea Friendship Association.
					The statement expressed belief that the Workers' Party of Korea and the Korean people would unite close around supreme leader Kim Jong Un true to the behests of leader Kim Jong Il and thus glorify 2012 as a year of proud victory in which the era of prosperity is unfolding.
					
					It said:
					
					We are convinced that the WPK and the Korean people will eternally preserve and glorify Comrade Kim Jong Il's revolutionary exploits and legacy and thoroughly implement his last instructions.
					
					We hope that the party, army and people of the DPRK will devotedly defend Comrade Kim Jong Un, banner of victory and honor of Songun Korea and center of unity, as a bulwark and shield and make a dynamic advance under his leadership.
					
					We call upon the political parties, governments and organizations of all countries of the world to positively support the WPK and the Korean people in their efforts to glorify another hundred-year history of Kim Il Sung's Korea as a year of prosperity and proud victory under the leadership of the great Comrade Kim Jong Un.
					
					The editorial boards of Trudovaya Rossia, the organ of the Communist Workers' Party of Russia-Revolutionary Communist Party of Russia, and its internet website issued a joint statement on Jan. 4 in support of the joint New Year editorial of the DPRK.

articles.title: Foreigners Express Confidence of Success in DPRK's Cause
articles.content:
Foreigners Express Confidence of Success in DPRK's Cause
Pyongyang, January 11 (KCNA) -- Personages of Myanmar and Indonesia released statements in support of the joint New Year editorial of Rodong Sinmun, Joson Inmingun and Chongnyon Jonwi, leading newspapers of the DPRK.
					Aung Thein Lynn, member of the Central Executive Committee of the Union Solidarity and Development Party, Union of Myanmar, in his statement on Jan. 2 fully supported the joint New Year editorial which called for turning out in the grand onward march for prosperity of the next 100 years of Juche under the leadership of the dear respected Kim Jong Un.
					
					The statement continued:
					
					HE Kim Jong Il was an outstanding and brilliant leader recognized and praised by the world.
					
					The DPRK's cause of building a thriving nation is sure to triumph as long as there are the invincible party, army and state developed by him, the wise leadership of HE Kim Jong Un, successor to the revolutionary cause of Juche, and the excellent people who remain loyal to their leaders generation after generation.
					
					I believe that the Korean people will build an economic power and radically improve the people's standard of living by carrying out tasks set forth in the editorial.
					
					I am firmly convinced that the party and people of the DPRK will build a thriving socialist nation and surely accomplish the cause of national reunification as desired by President Kim Il Sung and HE Kim Jong Il in lifetime, true to the leadership of HE Kim Jong Un, supreme leader of the DPRK.
					
					Basir, director of the P.T. Dwi Mitra Perkasa of Indonesia, in his statement on Jan. 5 expressed belief that the Korean people would achieve fresh victory in the drive for building a thriving nation by single-mindedly uniting around Kim Jong Un. 
					
					The secretary general, vice-president and members of the International Taekwon-Do Association in Iran visited the DPRK embassy in Tehran on the New Year's Day. 
					
					The secretary general hoped that the Korean people would make successful achievements in building a thriving nation under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Un, supreme leader, in the new year.

articles.title: Truth behind of Warship "Cheonan" Sinking Disclosed
articles.content:
Truth behind of Warship "Cheonan" Sinking Disclosed
Pyongyang, January 11 (KCNA) -- Sin Sang Chol, a former member of the joint team for investigation into the warship "Cheonan" sinking, posted an article disclosing the truth behind the case on an internet website of south Korea on Monday. 
					In the article he had already made a conclusion that there was no explosion that sent the warship into the bottom of the sea, adding he denied the fact that a torpedo went off below the ship. 
					
					That is to say, there was no torpedo at all, he stressed, and went on: 
					
					Discussion on the torpedo itself is a fabrication. 
					
					The Defense Ministry described the case as "sinking by explosion" and made an official announcement. Little over 15 days later, the joint investigation team announced that a thorough survey of the seabed of the waters close to the point where the stern of the ship sank resulted in discovering a torpedo. Then it opened the design of the torpedo and its photo to media. 
					
					But, the torpedo made public by the Defense Ministry for the first time touched off a dispute soon. There were many suspicions. Measurement of the design was not right. Why was the numerical value cm? The style of written language was not north's. Why is the torpedo so old as it had been under water just for 50-odd days? With what evidence do they prove the torpedo is from the north? 
					
					As these suspicions were made, the joint investigation team opened the "north's torpedo No. 1" in a glass box on May 20, 2010. 
					
					The appearance of the torpedo produced as a real thing, not one in photo, made the world attention distant from the photographed torpedo made public five days ago. 
					
					But, what mattered was the second. 
					
					A scrutiny into the torpedo in the photo and the second torpedo in a glass box shows they were not identical to each other. 
					
					At a glance, the second torpedo looks similar to the first torpedo. But it is not hard to clarify the fact that the comparison of every part with those of the torpedo produced earlier suggests that they are quite different from each other. 
					
					There were clear traces proving much effort was made to make the torpedo produced for the second time look similar to the first torpedo opened to media. 
					
					The results of the close photographing of the torpedo showed such clumsy work that traces of the work done by a press to make the parts of the controversial torpedo look similar to the old rusted parts in the center of the torpedo were clearly visible.  
					
					He consulted the two different torpedoes with lawyers and submitted its results to the court bench as evidence along with convincing opinions on them. 
					
					There were clear traces of rubbing rust to write "No. 1." How do you think about the fact that there were not one but two torpedoes, an indication of the height of fabrication?

articles.title: Hu Jintao Calls for Effective Anti-Corruption Drive
articles.content:
Hu Jintao Calls for Effective Anti-Corruption Drive
Beijing, January 10 (KCNA) -- Hu Jintao, general secretary of the C.C., Communist Party of China, on Monday stressed the need to conduct the anti-corruption drive in an effective way.
					Speaking at the 7th plenary session of the 17th Central Commission for Discipline Inspection of the C.C., CPC, he noted that the drive to establish the party discipline and enforce clean-handed policy and the fight on corruption are faced with new challenges.
					
					"We should be fully aware that the battle against corruption is time-consuming, complicated and difficult," he said. "We should have firm confidence and step up efforts."
					
					He called for making strict of the party discipline and stepping up the establishment of the style of work of the party. He also stressed the need to speed up the building of system to crack down on corruption and prevent graft and direct efforts to solving the highlighted problems reflecting the strong opinion of the popular masses.
					
					He said that new achievements should be scored in the drive to enforce the party discipline, ensure clean and honest policy and combat corruption ahead of the Party's 18th Congress.

articles.title: China Rejects U.S. Defense Strategy
articles.content:
China Rejects U.S. Defense Strategy
Beijing, January 10 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Chinese Foreign Ministry at a press conference on Monday clarified the country's stand against the new defense strategy of the United States.
					The accusation against China in a strategic defense guidance recently released by the U.S. Department of Defense is groundless and untrustworthy, he said.
					
					"China's national defense modernization serves the objective requirements of its national security and development, and it is a positive factor in maintaining regional peace and stability," he said, adding that the modernization will pose no threat to any country.
					
					On the same day a press spokesman for the Chinese Defense Ministry urged the U.S. side to take objective and reasonable attitude toward China and its army in conformity with the trend of the times and be deliberate in its words and deeds.

articles.title: China Launches Satellite
articles.content:
China Launches Satellite
Beijing, January 10 (KCNA) -- China succeeded in putting the satellite Ziyuan-3 into its preset orbit on Monday.
					Carrier rocket Changzheng-4 with the satellite atop blasted off from the Taiyuan Satellite Launching Center.
					
					The satellite is to be used for territorial research, prevention of disasters, protection of ecological environment and other purposes as well as agriculture and forestry.

articles.title: Chinese Official Calls for Development of Socialist Culture
articles.content:
Chinese Official Calls for Development of Socialist Culture
Beijing, January 10 (KCNA) -- A national meeting of publicity department heads took place in Beijing recently.
					Speaking at the meeting, Li Changchun, member of the Standing Committee of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the Communist Party of China, called on the officials of the ideological, cultural and publicity fields to persistently seek the development of socialist culture with the Chinese characteristics and keep in touch with the masses in accordance with the actual conditions of the country and the general requirement of serving people and making innovations.

articles.title: Development of Ethnic Regions Urged in China
articles.content:
Development of Ethnic Regions Urged in China
Beijing, January 10 (KCNA) -- A Chinese vice premier called for promoting a rapid development of minorities and ethnic regions.
					Speaking at a meeting of the national ethnic committee held a few days ago, Hui Liangyu called for thoroughly carrying out the plans and decisions on the development of minorities and ethnic regions during the period of the 12th five-year plan,
					
					"We should help ethnic regions attain a rapid development with their own characteristics." he said.

articles.title: Trade Unions Urged to Enhance Their Role in China
articles.content:
Trade Unions Urged to Enhance Their Role in China
Beijing, January 10 (KCNA) -- China's chairman of the All-China Federation of Trade Unions called on trade unions to enhance their role in ensuring the harmony and stability of society and the interests of the country and the people. 
					Wang Zhaoguo, at a recently-held round-table talk, said that by doing so, the trade unions at all levels should promote the building of a comprehensively well-off society and prosperity common to the popular masses.

articles.title: China Supports Resumption of Palestine-Israel Talks
articles.content:
China Supports Resumption of Palestine-Israel Talks
Beijing, January 10 (KCNA) -- The Chinese Foreign Ministry's spokesman Hong Lei voiced his country's support for the resumption of Palestine-Israel talks.
					Speaking at a press conference held recently, Hong said China hopes that relevant efforts will make a favorable progress to help resume the Palestine-Israel talks as soon as possible.

articles.title: China Supports Afghan Efforts for National Reconciliation
articles.content:
China Supports Afghan Efforts for National Reconciliation
Beijing, January 10 (KCNA) -- Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesman Hong Lei at a recent press conference voiced the country's support for the efforts of Afghanistan to realize national reconciliation.
					Hong expressed hope that Afghanistan will realize a peaceful stability as early as possible and make a progress in the process for reconciliation.
					
					He called on other parties outside Afghanistan to fully respect the choice of the Afghan government and people during peace talks and create a favorable environment for the reconciliation process.

articles.title: China Calls for Improving External Publicity
articles.content:
China Calls for Improving External Publicity
Beijing, January 10 (KCNA) -- A national meeting on external publicity work was held in Beijing recently.
					The meeting discussed enhancing the capacity and level of external publicity, introducing the Chinese culture and displaying the features of the country so as to greet the 18th Congress of the Communist Party of China (CPC) with great achievements.
					
					It also called for carrying on the external publicity work as a main point of the party and state affairs and giving priority to implementing the spirit of the 6th Plenum of the 17th CPC Central Committee.

articles.title: Development of Literature, Arts Urged in China
articles.content:
Development of Literature, Arts Urged in China
Beijing, January 10 (KCNA) -- Cai Wu, minister of Culture of China, called for propelling prosperity and development of literature and arts and intensifying cultural system reforms in 2012.
					Speaking at a recent national meeting of cultural officials, he underlined the need to strengthen the preservation of cultural relics and heritages, help the Chinese culture find itself in the world and increase the number of talents.

articles.title: Russia Develops New-type Strategic Missiles
articles.content:
Russia Develops New-type Strategic Missiles
Moscow, January 10 (KCNA) -- Russia is stepping up the development of new-type strategic missiles.
					The Strategic Rocket Forces would be equipped with new-type missiles, undetectable in any missile defense system, by 2018-2020, the ministry of Defense said Friday.

articles.title: Indian PM Says Gov't Committed to Bringing in Transparency
articles.content:
Indian PM Says Gov't Committed to Bringing in Transparency
New Delhi, January 10 (KCNA) -- Indian Prime Minister Manmohan Singh Sunday said the central government has been addressing the people's rising expectation for better governance and public services, and vowed to bring in greater transparency.
					"Our government is committed to doing so by providing security of education, nutrition and health to every Indian so that he or she is empowered to live a life of dignity and well being," he said.

articles.title: Iranian Majlis Speaker Denounces U.S. Alienation and Division Moves
articles.content:
Iranian Majlis Speaker Denounces U.S. Alienation and Division Moves
Tehran, January 10 (KCNA) -- Iranian Majlis speaker Ali Larijani in a speech in the Iranian Majlis on Jan. 8 denounced the alienation and division moves of the U.S. towards regional countries.
					It is the U.S. main strategy to sow religious discord among regional countries, he said, adding that the U.S. attempts to divert the opinions about its economic crisis and the shameful withdrawal of its forces from Iraq by making fantastic enemy or falsified target.
					
					The U.S. rulers in power should be well aware why the world people hate the U.S., he urged.

articles.title: Iran's Leader Clarifies Stand against West's Pressure
articles.content:
Iran's Leader Clarifies Stand against West's Pressure
Tehran, January 10 (KCNA) -- Seyed Ali Khamenei, leader of the Islamic Revolution of Iran, on Monday clarified the country's stand not to yield to the West's pressure imposed over its nuclear program.
					"The western officials have said that the sanctions aimed to get the people out of scene and pressure Iranian officials to revise their calculation, but they are making mistake and they will not reach their goal," he said. 
					
					The supreme leader said that the movement of Iranian nation to reach the heights of glory cannot be halted.

articles.title: Dialogue Only Way to Resolve Iran's Nuclear Issues: Pakistani Senator
articles.content:
Dialogue Only Way to Resolve Iran's Nuclear Issues: Pakistani Senator
Pyongyang, January 11 (KCNA) -- A former Pakistani minister on Friday welcomed Iran's decision to invite Group 5+1 on negotiation table over its peaceful nuclear program, adding that dialogue is the only way to resolve the issues.
					Talking to IRNA, Senator S.M. Zafar of Pakistan Muslim League-Q said that Iran being an independent state has the right to acquire nuclear technology for peaceful purposes.

articles.title: Nicaraguan Gov't Will Expand Benefit Program for Poor Children
articles.content:
Nicaraguan Gov't Will Expand Benefit Program for Poor Children
Pyongyang, January 11 (KCNA) -- The Nicaraguan government will expand its program that serves the education of poor children in the country, to over 1.2 million families in the period 2012-2016, according to Voice of the Sandinismus on Friday.

articles.title: New Bridge Built in Mexico
articles.content:
New Bridge Built in Mexico
Pyongyang, January 11 (KCNA) -- New bridge has been recently built in Mexico.
					The bridge spans a deep ravine in the Sierra Madre Occidental mountains in northern Mexico.
					
					It is expected to open to traffic later this year, and Mexican officials hope it will boost tourism and commerce in the region.

articles.title: Over 7 000 Haitians Died of Cholera in 2011
articles.content:
Over 7 000 Haitians Died of Cholera in 2011
Pyongyang, January 11 (KCNA) -- More than 7 000 people died of cholera in Haiti in 2011 and 520 000, over 5 percent of the population, was infected, according to the country's Ministry of Health on Saturday.
					Measures for preventing spread of the disease are being taken.

articles.title: El Salvador Created Over 50 000 Permanent Jobs in 2011
articles.content:
El Salvador Created Over 50 000 Permanent Jobs in 2011
Pyongyang, January 11 (KCNA) -- El Salvador has directed efforts to creating jobs.
					Labor Minister Humberto Centeno said on Saturday that 50 301 formal jobs were created in the country last year.

articles.title: 77 865 kgs of Narcotics Seized in Pakistan in 2011
articles.content:
77 865 kgs of Narcotics Seized in Pakistan in 2011
Pyongyang, January 11 (KCNA) -- Pakistan's Anti Narcotics Forces (ANF) seized a total of 77 865 kilograms of narcotics from different parts of the country in 2011, the ANF said on Saturday.

articles.title: Protest against High Unemployment in Turkey
articles.content:
Protest against High Unemployment in Turkey
Pyongyang, January 11 (KCNA) -- A large number of citizens in Turkey staged a protest against the authorities' wrong policy on Saturday.
					They gathered in Istanbul's city center of Taksim square to protest against high unemployment in the country.

articles.title: Nigeria Strives for Social Stability
articles.content:
Nigeria Strives for Social Stability
Pyongyang, January 11 (KCNA) -- The Nigerian government has recently directed big efforts to ensuring social stability in the country while frustrating the moves of extremists and the U.S. interference.
					President Goodluck Ebele Jonathan in his New Year address on Jan. 1 set it as a major task for 2012 to protect the life and property of the people and develop the country.
					
					The government is taking steps to foil any domestic and foreign machinations and ensure national security and social stability by concerted efforts.
					
					The government will strengthen the security system to cope with terrorism in an effective way, the president said, calling on all the people to join in the combat against terrorism.
					
					On Dec. 31 last year Nigeria declared emergency situation to some northern areas of the country with an aim to check criminal deeds of the extremists.
					
					The meeting of heads of religious and security organs held in Gombe State on Friday discussed the issue of taking all possible measures to prevent victims caused by terrorism.
					
					All state governments are protecting people's life and property as well as supplying medicines and other living conditions to victims of terrorism in a responsible manner.
					
					The international community has expressed support and solidarity with the Nigerian government and people in their efforts to achieve social stability.

articles.title: Capitalist Society Is That of Immorality and Depravity
articles.content:
Capitalist Society Is That of Immorality and Depravity
Pyongyang, January 11 (KCNA) -- Capitalist society is falling deeper into quagmire of bankruptcy as all descriptions of immorality and depravity are rife.
					Horrible incidents occurred one after another in the capitalist countries including the United States and Japan in recent months.
					
					In December last year a dead body of a seven-year old girl was found in the garbage ground of an apartment building in Atlantic City of New Jersey State, the U.S. Traces proving that she was sexually assaulted and wounds caused by stab were reportedly found on her head and several other parts of her body.
					
					Earlier in July, an 8-year old girl was also found dead in this country after she was kidnapped.
					
					It was reported in mid December last year that a 25-year old woman in Kobe City, Hyogo Prefecture of Japan, dragged her 3-year old son with dirty bag on his head, stunning the public.
					
					A frolicsome child free from worries had to be a victim of violence beyond the imagination, even being badly treated by its parent--this is the true picture of corrupt capitalist society. 
					
					In capitalist society peace is hard to expect on the New Year due to crimes committed all the year.
					
					At the dawn of the New Year people were seized with anxiety and panic at the gunshot.
					
					In the vicinity of San Diego, California State of the U.S., an unidentified criminal broke into a flat and shot four people to death on the New Year.
					
					A shooting in the UK on Jan. 2 left three people dead.
					
					All the facts clearly show that capitalist society is a veritable hell, a rotten and ailing society.

articles.title: Philippines to Grow 5-6 Pct in 2012, Economic Managers Predict
articles.content:
Philippines to Grow 5-6 Pct in 2012, Economic Managers Predict
Pyongyang, January 11 (KCNA) -- Economic managers of the Philippine government have said that the country's gross domestic product (GDP) would grow by 5 to 6 percent this year.

articles.title: Financial Crisis in Europe
articles.content:
Financial Crisis in Europe
Pyongyang, January 11 (KCNA) -- The European Union is suffering the worst crisis since its birth 19 years back due to the ever-deepening debt and financial crisis. 
					The national debt crisis in Europe which occurred in the wake of the rapid spread of the financial crisis in the United States is now hitting such countries as France and Spain. 
					
					France and Spain are the countries rated second and fourth in the Eurozone. 
					
					However, the interest rates of national bonds issued by those countries recently reached 7 percent, a dangerous level. 
					
					Euro value fell down when Italy sold a six month term bond with a promise to pay interest double the usual one. 
					
					National debt crisis in Europe is one of the important factors affecting world economy. 
					
					President of France Nicolas Sarkozy warned the EU would collapse unless there is an immediate step to settle the financial crisis. 
					
					This indicates the seriousness of the debts crisis and financial crisis in Europe. 
					
					Member nations of the EU are getting positive to save Euro and its zone. 
					
					The EU gave emergency relief fund to Greece several times to solve its financial crisis which was the starting point of driving the Eurozone into a predicament. 
					
					At the request of financial aid by Ireland, Portugal and Italy, the Europe Central Bank took a step of lowering the standard of interest rates. 
					
					Countries in Europe agreed to collect fund of 150 billion Euros to solve the financial crisis. 
					
					The EU summit held in December last year adopted a new economic convention the keynote of which is to intensify the control over national budgets of its member nations with a goal to implement the policy of unified currency in a uniform way. 
					
					Majority of EU members fully seconded this. 
					
					Leaders of the EU believe that the new convention will positively contribute to ensuring the lasting stability of Euro. 
					
					Xinhua news of China, conveying the decision of the EU summit, said this helped dispel the speculation that the Eurozone would meet its end. The decision offered an opportunity for solidifying the integration of Europe, it added. 
					
					Russian Prime Minister Vladimir Putin said there is no hopeless tendency as regards the national debt crisis in Europe, expressing expectation for the EU activities to save the Eurozone. 
					
					The EU efforts are still going on to save Euro and Eurozone.

articles.title: Iran Plans to Set Up Antarctic Scientific Research Base
articles.content:
Iran Plans to Set Up Antarctic Scientific Research Base
Tehran, January 10 (KCNA) -- Iran is planning to set up a scientific research base in the Antarctic within three years.
					Recently, the director of the Oceanography Research Institute of Iran said that the country will build an icebreaker and study technologies of iceberg traction, arctic clothes manufacture and ice boring for the purpose of scientific researches and transport.    
					
					The establishment of the base is to take six stages. The first stage is the organization of the Antarctic Research Center.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un recibe mensaje de pesame del premier de Granadas
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un recibe mensaje de pesame del premier de Granadas
Pyongyang, 11 de enero (ACNC) -- El Maximo Dirigente del pueblo coreano Kim Jong Un recibio un mensaje de condolencias que le dirigiera el 19 de diciembre del ano pasado el premier de Granadas Tillman Thomas.
					El texto sigue:
					
					El fallecimiento de Kim Jong Il, Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, es una gran tristeza para el gobierno y pueblo de Granadas.
					
					Con motivo de su deceso, extiendo a usted y al gobierno y el pueblo de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea las mas sentidas condolencias en nombre del gobierno y pueblo de Granadas.
					
					El deceso del Presidente Kim Jong Il hizo sufrir una gran perdida al pueblo coreano.
					
					Aprovecho esta ocasion para afirmarle que el gobierno y el pueblo de Granadas expresaran sinceras condolencias al pueblo coreano en el periodo de duelo nacional.

articles.title: MINREX se refiere a la ayuda de alimentos de EE.UU.
articles.content:
MINREX se refiere a la ayuda de alimentos de EE.UU.
Pyongyang, 11 de enero (ACNC) -- Con respecto a la ayuda de alimentos de Estados Unidos, el portavoz del Ministerio de Relaciones Exteriores de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea dio el dia 11 la siguiente respuesta a la ACNC: 
					En estos momentos, algunas fuerzas difunden unos rumores malintencionados tergiversando a su antojo las circunstancias de la ayuda alimentaria a Corea de Estados Unidos. 
					
					Lo insoslayable del caso es que las fuerzas hostiles maldicen como si la RPDC hubiera pedido los alimentos porque cayo en un trance debido al gran duelo nacional. 
					
					La ayuda alimentaria, que discuten ahora la RPDC y EE.UU., fue planteada ya a principios de 2011 como tema de suministro de 330 mil toneladas, restantes de 500 mil toneladas prometidas por el segundo a la primera hace 3 anos. 
					
					Al principio, EE.UU. insistia en que la donacion de alimentos es un asunto humanitario que no tiene nada que ver con la politica. 
					
					Pero, EE.UU. la politizo durante las conversaciones de alto nivel entre ambos paises, iniciadas en julio de 2011, al plantear que discutiria las medidas para la creacion de confianza como el cese temporal de las sanciones y ofreceria simultaneamente los alimentos, en el caso de que la RPDC acepte las medidas de esa indole pedidas por aquel como la suspension temporal de enriquecimiento de uranio. 
					
					EE.UU. altero mucho la cantidad y renglones de suministros, a diferencia de la ayuda de mas de 300 mil toneladas debatida inicialmente.
					
					Por eso, ponemos en duda la voluntad de EE.UU. de crear la confianza y le exigimos volver a los puntos discutidos en mayo de 2011. 
					
					Observaremos si EE.UU. tiene de veras la voluntad de establecer la confianza con nuestro pais.

articles.title: Presidente guineo desea desarrollo de relaciones con RPDC
articles.content:
Presidente guineo desea desarrollo de relaciones con RPDC
Pyongyang, 11 de enero (ACNC) -- El presidente de la Republica de Guinea, Alpha Conde, se reunio el dia 4 con el encargado de negocios a.i. de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea acreditado en su pais, Kim Su Il. 
					En la ocasion el mandatario volvio a expresar sinceras condolencias por el gran duelo nacional que sufrio inesperadamente el pueblo coreano. 
					
					Deseo que el pueblo coreano supere la tristeza y logre con el coraje recobrado mayores exitos en el cumplimiento de las tareas economicas indicadas en el editorial conjunto del Ano Nuevo y en la lucha por la reunificacion de la patria, apoyando a Su Excelencia Kim Jong Un. 
					
					Expreso la esperanza de que las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre los dos paises con larga tradicion sigan desarrollandose constantemente.

articles.title: ACNC comenta crimenes de lesa humanidad de Japon
articles.content:
ACNC comenta crimenes de lesa humanidad de Japon
Pyongyang, 11 de enero (ACNC) -- Se expanden en escala mundial los movimientos para demandar a Japon la disculpa oficial y la indemnizacion por sus crimenes del caso de ex consoladoras sexuales para el viejo ejercito japones. 
					Se han desarrollado sucesivamente las actividades solidarias en mas de 40 ciudades de 9 paises y regiones como Estados Unidos, Alemania, Canada e Italia. 
					
					Bajo los auspicios del Consejo por la Solucion del Problema de las Tropas de Voluntarios en el Sur de Corea, se desarrolla cada semana desde el 8 de enero de 1992 el mitin del miercoles frente al edificio de la embajada japonesa en Seul, cuyo numero llega a mas de mil ocasiones. 
					
					Hace poco, por la unanime demanda de los habitantes de distintos estratos del Sur de Corea se ha construido la lapida de paz reflejando la colera arraigada de las mujeres coreanas arrestadas y violadas en el tiempo pasado como esclavas sexuales para el viejo ejercito japones. 
					
					Sin embargo, Japon habla de la retirada de esa lapida sin hacer caso de la demanda de la sociedad internacional por el respecto. 
					
					Durante mas de 40 anos de su dominacion colonial sobre Corea, Japon cometio los crimenes antieticos crueles nunca vistos en la historia humana.  
					
					En particular, el crimen del caso de mas de 200 mil ex consoladoras coreanas es mas grosero y mas salvaje tanto en su caracter siniestro como en su dimension y organizacion. 
					
					Lo que no se puede tolerar es que se tornan cada dia mas abiertas las maniobras de los reaccionarios japoneses tendentes a negar el caso de ex consoladoras coreanas a contrapelo de las altas voces de la sociedad internacional en demanda de la liquidacion del pasado criminal. 
					
					Los japoneses dicen que "Japon no siente que cometio crimenes en el periodo de la Segunda Guerra Mundial" y aboga por modificar la declaracion del director del secretariado del gabinete, Kono, publicada en el ano 1993 reconociendo la responsabilidad por el caso de ex consoladoras. 
					
					En este mundo no habra otro pais que pueda superar a Japon en el cinismo. 
					
					Por haber eludido hasta la hecha su responsabilidad por la liquidacion del pasado, Japon tiene la deshonra vergonzosa de enano politico. 
					
					Aunque pasaron mas de 60 anos desde el fin de la Segunda Guerra Mundial, la sociedad internacional considera a Japon como pais indigno de confianza por sus crimenes del pasado no eliminados. 
					
					He aqui la perdida politica cientos de veces mas caros que el precio economico por la liquidacion del pasado. 
					
					Mientras que Japon niega sus crimenes antieticos cometidos en el siglo pasado, estos se agrandan tanto mas como bolas de nieve. 
					
					El pais isleno debe liberarse cuanto antes de la concepcion de miope y liquidar cuento antes su pasado sucio.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun da por invalidados 3 principios de exportacion de Japon
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun da por invalidados 3 principios de exportacion de Japon
Pyongyang, 11 de enero (ACNC) -- A finales de diciembre del ano expirado, el gobierno de Japon enmendo por fin los "tres principios de exportacion de armas", de modo que permitan desarrollar los pertrechos de defensa con otros paises o transferirlos al extranjero.
					Perplejo ante la avalancha de criticas de los partidos opositores, el poder del Partido Democratico de Japon se apresuro a declarar que no cambiaria el principio y el ideal pacifistas y la enmienda se trata de un relajamiento de esos principios.
					
					Al respecto, el diario Rodong Sinmun divulgo hoy un comentario individual cuyo texto resumido sigue:
					
					La reciente enmienda de los "tres principios de exportacion de armas" de Japon significa la eliminacion de los mismos y la declaracion de impulsar en etapa crucial la conversion en una potencia militar y el expansionismo a ultramar.
					
					Para disimular el caracter criminal y peligroso de tales ambiciones, la capa gobernante de Japon insiste en que la exportacion de armas de su pais tiene las misiones de paz y humanitarismo.
					
					Japon, enloquecido por hacerse una potencia militar, se concentra ahora en elevar la capacidad de ataque y movilidad de sus "Fuerzas de Autodefensa". Su actual "programa de defensa" hace enfasis en la construccion de buques de guerra y en el cambio de los cazas principales a traves del desarrollo conjunto con Estados Unidos de las tecnologias de industria belica.
					
					Mediante esa labor y otras, Japon trata de adquirir las tecnologias belicas sofisticadas y tomar la heguemonia militar en Asia.
					
					Todos sus pasos obedecen a su meta final de reagredir el continente asiatico.
					
					Evidentemente dicho, Japon es pais muy peligroso en Asia Oriental.
					
					Es natural que los paises vecinos tomen precaucion  sobre  Japon.
